page.title: 17To Bypass or not to Bypass!
page.content:
{That is the question!
Hillend is a small village, northeast of Inverkeithing. It lies on the main{ {A92}road, a vital contact between east and west Fife. As a result, heavy traffic is constantly travelling along the small main street of Hillend. A vigourous campaign is underway by the inhabitants to have a bypass constructed.
A protest is carried out regularly with citizens standing at (and crossing often) the pedestrian crossing, with banners stating 'Go slow!' and 'Keep to the speed limit'. This results in very annoyed drivers in a two-mile tailback, but has seemingly not had much success in the intended area.
